content.description:
This route might be intimidating to a new leader. The top portion looks unprotectable from the ground, but there are some goodÂ placements the entire way.

Don't be swooned into the dirty chimney to the right! Climb the face just right of the arete! That's where the 3 stars are. The chimney is terrible.

Descent:

Walk off left.
content.protection: Mostly small cams and nuts, up to BD #1. Two bolt anchor (no chains or rings) over the lip at the top (can be accessed from above to setup/clean). Bring cordelette.
content.location: All the way lookers left on Fish Face. Just left of a bolt line (After Dance 5.8).

content.description: Ultra classic route, on par with the best, crush this route! Make your way up easy terrain to a good rest below the obvious roof. Clip the fixed pin and take er' to the summit via sustained climbing on the best the canyon has to offer.
content.location: The looker's right most route on the wall. Look for the fixed pin and obvious line of ascent above the roof on the right side of the formation.

content.description: If you don't like this pitch, you don't like crack climbing... Bring all sizes of cams up to 3 Camalot. Maybe bring a 4 Friend for the top? Steep climbing with good pro. What are you waiting for? Walk off to the climber's left.
content.location: Left side of Fish Face Wall, just left of Crystal Delight.

climbs.name: Crystal Delight
climbs.fa: Jack Tackle, Brian Leo, Doug Randall - 1978

content.description: Crystal delight starts on the L side of fish face wall. This route doesn't look like much from the ground, but ended up being a blast! Climb up the white crystal dyke passing by a few pins along the way. Pro is great on this pitch, so don't hesitate to jump on it!
content.location: Walk off to the climber's left.

content.description:
One of the better Dockins' routes, this adventure starts on a ledge on the left edge of Fish Face behind a large tree. Sparse and creative placements head up and left (5.8R/X) to a lone bolt at ~80'. From here the troubles begin but good gear will inspire you through to a large ledge (5.11d). Romp to the top and an anchor.

Serious lead with substantial mandatory 5.8X climbing. By far one of the best committing leads in the Gallatin!
content.protection: Brassies; triples to 0.5; singles to 3. Beaks and a hammer will help your courage during the opening vision quest.
content.location:
Starts off a ramp to the right of Crystal Delight.

Rap route with 2 70m's or an easy walk off (preferred).

content.description:
A rare canyon easy sport route. Fun face climbing on nicely featured canyon gneiss. This route will keep you thinking in several locations.

Descent:

Rappel route.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchor bolts with rap rings.
content.location: Far lookers left of Fish Face area. Bolt line just right of Not in Vein. Large dead/down tree at base of cliff.
